WRITING.TEXT: "The Middle" is also pretty decent show that is endearing in its attempts to appeal to the middle class.
They said there was no tie to ISIS, but that they consider it a hate crime.

You're saying that if she ran as an independent without backing from the DNC that she still stood a possibility of winning? I guess it's possible, although it would be shocking and unprecedented. I would question how such an endeavor would even work, considering how intertwined her campaign was with those who work for and donate to the DNC.
The fact that people like you still don't understand why Hillary Clinton was a bad candidate is exactly why people still have to talk about her failed candidacy.
She would not have won a majority of votes if she was not propped-up by the DNC. She was a flawed candidate that the DNC should not have run with.
